text: Thanks for the info. We're trying to improve speed to improve SEO.

*How do you guys select _custom object input fields_ in forms?* It has this awful numeric values and slash in front of attributes. Like this: `<input name="2-9500644/berufserfahrung" (...) />`  I mean, what is that?! Where does this `2-9500644/`  come from? That looks totally wrong. And is ugly to work with!
the 2-970500644 is the custom object type id
Just like 0-1 is the type id for contacts
and 0-2 is the type id for companies
<@U01QVR44MEY> *And where do I get that type ID from?* It's not part of the HubL Object and nowhere to be found in the CRM-property fields. How can I build a selector for that field?
When the custom object is created HubSpot returns the type id
You can all get it from the url of  the list page for the object

Okay, good to know. Meanwhile I found out that the `*=` of the CSS3 Selectors work for Javascript as well. To get that input field I can go with:
```document.querySelector('input[name*="berufserfahrung"]');```
